summary: This document is a compilation of Bureau of Prisons health service records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering the period from July 7, 2019, to August 10, 2019. It includes detailed medical assessments, vital signs, medication orders, and health problem lists, providing a comprehensive view of his physical and mental health status while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. A series of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) health services records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering his initial intake and subsequent medical, dental, and vision screenings at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York from July to August 2019. The documents detail his medical history, physical condition, prescribed medications, and housing/duty status. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons medical records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering the period from July 9 to July 28, 2019. It includes laboratory results, clinical encounter notes, and administrative notes detailing his health status, reported injuries, and refusal of treatment while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. This document contains Bureau of Prisons medical records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, including a clinical encounter from July 23, 2019, where he was examined for neck injuries after being found with a rope around his neck in his cell. It also includes earlier chronic care evaluations, treatment refusal forms, and dental examination records from July 2019. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons medical records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein from July and August 2019. It includes treatment refusal forms, dental and chronic care examinations, and a detailed clinical encounter documenting his cardiac arrest and resuscitation on August 10, 2019. The records show Epstein refused certain evaluations and detail his medical complaints and conditions while incarcerated.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of all medical and administrative records; a 66-year-old male inmate undergoing health screenings and receiving treatment for conditions like constipation and sleep apnea.

persons.name: Robert Beaudouin
persons.context: Listed as a provider for a blood pressure reading on July 30, 2019, indicating he was part of the medical staff attending to Epstein.

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: A healthcare provider (e.g., nurse practitioner or physician assistant) who conducts follow-up visits and injury assessments for Jeffrey Epstein, documenting his statements about a possible assault.

persons.name: DDS
persons.context: A dentist who performed Epstein's dental health history screen and A&O (Assessment and Orientation) exam on July 26, 2019.

persons.name: Dental Asst
persons.context: A dental assistant who noted on July 18, 2019, that Epstein had missed several scheduled dental screening appointments.

persons.name: RN/IOP/IDC
persons.context: Health services staff who generated immunization records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of all medical records, undergoing lab tests and clinical evaluations while incarcerated at MCC New York. He reports injuries and refuses an eye doctor evaluation.

persons.name: Beaudouin, Robert
persons.context: Appears as a provider (MD) who conducted examinations and signed off on medical records for Jeffrey Epstein in July 2019.

connections.description: Epstein was under the medical care of the MD, who reviewed his labs and prescribed medications.
The MLP conducted Epstein's primary intake physical examination and documented his medical history.
The dentist performed a dental examination and assessment on Epstein.
Both are healthcare providers for the BOP; the MLP's notes required cosignature by the MD.
Epstein is the inmate patient receiving medical care and evaluations from the MD provider.
Epstein is assessed and monitored by the RN for symptoms like neuropathy and vital signs.
Epstein is evaluated by the MLP for injuries and makes statements implicating his cellmate.
Dr. Beaudouin was a medical doctor who evaluated and provided care for inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC.

events.title: Initial Health Assessment
events.description: Epstein undergoes an initial health assessment at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, recording vitals, height, weight, and a PPD test for tuberculosis.

events.title: Chronic Care Physician Evaluation
events.description: A detailed clinical encounter where Epstein reports a history of hypertriglyceridemia, sleep apnea, and severe lower back pain causing numbness and shooting pain. New medications are prescribed.

events.title: Injury Assessment
events.description: An injury is documented and listed as 'R/O self Inflicted injuries' (Rule Out self-inflicted injuries), indicating a concern noted by medical staff.

events.title: Diet Restriction and CPAP Issuance
events.description: A fish allergy is formally documented as a diet restriction, and a CPAP machine for sleep apnea is issued to Epstein.

events.title: Medical Record Compilation/Transfer
events.description: A comprehensive set of medical records is generated, possibly in preparation for a transfer, summarizing all health data from July 7 to August 10, 2019.

events.title: Initial Health Services Intake
events.description: Epstein's initial administrative health intake at the MCC, where lab tests (CBC, metabolic panel, HIV, RPR) and a chest X-ray were ordered.

events.title: Comprehensive History & Physical Exam
events.description: A detailed medical history and physical examination performed by an MLP, documenting Epstein's denial of abuse history, sexual history (104 female partners in last 5 years), travel, and current health status.

events.title: Dental Health Assessment
events.description: A dental examination revealing fair oral hygiene, gingival recession, crowding, and one missing tooth.

events.title: CPAP Machine Issued
events.description: A CPAP machine was issued to Epstein for treatment of sleep apnea, with an equipment start date of July 30, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's Blood Sample Collected
events.description: A blood sample is collected from Jeffrey Epstein for laboratory testing at MCC New York.

events.title: Epstein Reports Neck Injury
events.description: Epstein is assessed for a neck injury with erythema and abrasion. He states he woke up 'snorting' and implies his cellmate was involved but refuses to elaborate.

events.title: Epstein Refuses Eye Evaluation
events.description: Epstein signs a Bureau of Prisons form refusing recommended treatment for an eye doctor evaluation.

events.title: Epstein Reports Neuropathy Symptoms
events.description: Epstein reports waking up with loss of control and numbness in his right arm, described as 'pins and needles'.

events.title: Epstein found with rope around neck
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor. He was examined by medical staff, showed a circular line of erythema on his neck, and was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Chronic care medical evaluation
events.description: Epstein underwent a chronic care physician evaluation at the prison health services, discussing his medical history including hypertriglyceridemia, sleep apnea, and back pain.

events.title: Refusal of eye doctor evaluation
events.description: Epstein signed a Medical Treatment Refusal form, declining a recommended eye doctor evaluation.

events.title: Refusal of chest X-ray
events.description: Epstein signed a Medical Treatment Refusal form, declining a recommended routine chest X-ray.

events.title: Epstein Refuses Chest X-Ray
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed a medical treatment refusal form, declining a recommended routine chest X-ray.

events.title: Epstein Refuses Eye Doctor Evaluation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed a medical treatment refusal form, declining a recommended eye doctor evaluation.

events.title: Chronic Care Evaluation
events.description: Epstein was evaluated by medical staff after referral by the warden. He reported being without his medications for a week, numbness in his right arm, sleep apnea due to lack of CPAP, and other conditions.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive & Resuscitation Attempt
events.description: At approximately 06:35, correctional officers responded to a body alarm and found Epstein unresponsive on the floor of his cell with CPR in progress. He was cold, with bruising around the neck and fixed, dilated pupils. Extensive resuscitation efforts were performed, including CPR, intubation, and medication administration, before he was transported to a local ER with CPR still in progress.

locations: NEW YORK MCC, 150 PARK ROW, NEW YORK, New York 10007
Mount Sinai Hospital (location of past hospitalization for appendicitis in 1990)
Paris (mentioned as travel destination prior to arrest)
Federal Bureau of Prisons U.S. Medical Center for Federal Prisons, 1900 W. Sunshine Street, Springfield, MO 65807
MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
Special Housing Unit Z05 - Cell 124 (location of reported injury)
U.S. Medical Center for Federal Prisons, 1900 W. Sunshine Street, Springfield, MO 65807
Health Services Unit (HSU) treatment room (within MCC)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's medical records list multiple health issues including hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, hypertension, prediabetes, constipation, low back pain, and neuralgia.
An entry dated July 23, 2019, lists 'Injury, unspecified' with the note 'R/O self Inflicted injuries,' indicating medical staff were assessing a potential self-harm incident.
Epstein was prescribed regular insulin subcutaneously according to a sliding scale, indicating management of elevated blood glucose levels.
The records show he was issued a CPAP machine for sleep apnea on July 30, 2019, and had a documented fish allergy.
The documents are sensitive Bureau of Prisons health records generated on August 10, 2019, covering his incarceration period leading up to his death.
Epstein's medical intake documents his sexual history, stating he had 104 female sexual partners in the last 5 years and sometimes used condoms.
Epstein denied any history of physical, emotional, or sexual abuse during his intake screening.
Epstein had a history of chlamydia in 2015, which was treated, and chicken pox in childhood.
Medical records show Epstein was prescribed medications for constipation, high triglycerides (Omega-3/Vascepa), and was issued a CPAP machine for sleep apnea.
Epstein was housed in a single cell on the first floor (Quarters Z04) and was assigned a lower bunk, per medical duty status forms.
Jeffrey Epstein's laboratory results from July 9-10, 2019, show elevated cholesterol (216 mg/dL), high triglycerides (413 mg/dL), and a low HDL level (31 mg/dL).
On July 23, 2019, Epstein reported a neck injury with erythema and abrasion, implying to medical staff that his cellmate 'had to do with what happened' but refused to provide details.
Epstein signed a formal refusal of treatment (BOP Form S-358.060) on July 24, 2019, declining an eye doctor evaluation.
On July 28, 2019, Epstein reported neurological symptoms including temporary loss of control and numbness in his right arm upon waking.
Medical records indicate Epstein was housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU Z05, Cell 124) at MCC New York at the time of his reported injury.
On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his prison cell with a rope around his neck, resulting in a circular erythema (redness) mark.
Epstein told medical staff he did not know what happened and could not explain the marks on his neck, and he did not want to talk about the events leading to them.
Following the incident, Epstein was placed on suicide watch by Bureau of Prisons staff.
Epstein had a history of medical conditions including hypertriglyceridemia, obstructive sleep apnea, and severe spinal stenosis causing numbness and shooting pain.
Epstein refused several recommended medical treatments while in custody, including an eye doctor evaluation and a routine chest X-ray.
Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC New York on the morning of August 10, 2019, with CPR already in progress by correctional officers.
The resuscitation record notes the inmate was 'cold, with circumferential bruising around the neck and posterior mottling' and had 'pupils fixed and dilated' upon initial assessment.
Epstein had refused recommended medical treatments, including a routine chest X-ray on July 10 and an eye doctor evaluation on July 24, 2019.
During a medical evaluation on July 30, 2019, Epstein reported he had been without his medications for about a week and had experienced concerning numbness in his right arm.
The document provides detailed, contemporaneous medical records from the Bureau of Prisons covering the period leading up to Epstein's death.
